private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
I can only move one disk at a time and only the top disk of a peg
agent_1.goal: Help reach the target configuration: left peg top-to-bottom C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top-to-bottom A, B; right peg empty

private_information: I can move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O
I can only move one disk at a time and only the top disk of a peg
agent_2.goal: Help reach the target configuration: left peg top-to-bottom C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top-to-bottom A, B; right peg empty

private_information: I coordinate agents to produce a single coherent plan and a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and problem
I must keep agent actions distinct and enforce Tower of Hanoi rules
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent plans and produce a final valid PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward and an ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the global goal

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right
There are 15 disks labeled A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O with A the smallest and O the largest
Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O and middle empty and right empty
Goal configuration left peg top-to-bottom C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O and middle peg top-to-bottom A, B and right empty
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time, only the top disk of any peg may be moved, and a larger disk may not be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agent move restrictions are public knowledge: agent_1 may move disks A through H and agent_2 may move disks I through O

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You are responsible for moving disks A B C D E F G H. Provide an ordered sequence of primitive moves that you can perform to help realize the global goal. Use the exact move format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Do not produce PDDL.
plan.prompt: You are agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide a step by step ordered list of primitive moves you can perform in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Only include moves that you are allowed to perform and that respect Tower of Hanoi rules.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You are responsible for moving disks I J K L M N O. Provide an ordered sequence of primitive moves that you can perform to help realize the global goal. Use the exact move format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Do not produce PDDL.
plan.prompt: You are agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide a step by step ordered list of primitive moves you can perform in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Only include moves that you are allowed to perform and that respect Tower of Hanoi rules.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator producing a final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownward planner. Integrate agent partial plans, resolve naming differences and conflicts, keep agent actions distinct, and enforce Tower of Hanoi rules. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Also output a validated, ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You receive the following partial agent plans: {plan_agent_1} and {plan_agent_2}. Public environment info: {environment->public_information}. Orchestrate and integrate these plans into a single valid plan. Produce two outputs: 1) A PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownward enclosed respectively in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags. 2) A final ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' that respects agent move restrictions and Tower of Hanoi rules and achieves the global goal {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Keep actions for agent_1 and agent_2 distinct in the PDDL and in the move list.
